definition: to pull/to draw/to pull back/to withdraw/to flash past
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap

sentences.english: There is no door closing button. Press any floor button to close the landing door.
sentences.chinese: 這裏沒有關門按掣，按下任何樓層按鈕以關閉機門。

sentences.english: I stepped on the brake to avoid an accident.
sentences.chinese: 我踏腳掣以避免一宗意外的發生。

sentences.english: Turn on a radio by using a timer.
sentences.chinese: 利用時間掣開關收音機。

sentences.english: The ventilation fan switch on the button panel does not work here.
sentences.chinese: 掣板上的抽風機開關掣在這裏並不能運作。

sentences.english: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
sentences.chinese: 掣籤能止息爭競，也能解散強勝的人。

sentences.english: He quickly drew back his hand.
Turn off the main power of your television before you go out or sleep.
sentences.chinese: 外出和睡覺之前，關掉電視機的總掣。

sentences.english: Cars also use water to cool their engines.
sentences.chinese: 驕車也通過熱水爲引掣降溫。

sentences.english: To close the landing door, press either floor button.
sentences.chinese: 如要關上機門，就按下其中一個樓層按掣。

sentences.english: Light switches in the plant room are all timer switches.
sentences.chinese: 位於機房內的全部燈光開關器都裝設了時間掣。

sentences.english: The operation of the powertrain relay switchbox on startup from the top floor is rather loud.
sentences.chinese: 由頂層起動時，驅動機芯開關跳掣的操作音量頗大。

sentences.english: 9he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
sentences.chinese: 照祭司的規矩掣籤，得進主殿燒香。

sentences.english: And they cast lots by fathers' houses, small and great alike, for their gates.
sentences.chinese: 他們無論大小，都按著宗族掣籤分守各門。

sentences.english: According to the custom of the priest's office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 照祭司的規矩掣籤，得進主殿燒香。

sentences.english: Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.
sentences.chinese: 他的兒子撒迦利亞是精明的謀士，掣籤守北門。

definition: to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
(old)(interjection expressing disapproval, commiseration etc) tut!/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
